head.supplied: Chief Secretary's Office, ¶ Melbourne, 31st July, 1885. ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ I have the honor to forward herewith for your information and guidance a copy of a further letter addressed to me by the Under Treas...

div.p: No. 2869, p. 992, unit 70, VPRS 1187/P, outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office of Victoria.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Geneva, Geneva; text-align: end;

div.p: Document is a circular to the heads of 15 departments within the Chief Secretary’s Department, with the addressee inscribed in each case as appropriate. Chief Secretary's Office,

p.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Geneva, Geneva; text-align: end;

div.p:
I have the honor to forward herewith for your information and guidance a copy of a further letter addressed to me by the Under Treasurer with reference to the course to be observed in collecting sums payable by Public Servants as rents .
See H. Moors to M, 31 July 1885, and T. Wilson to M, 29 July 1885.
There must be a copy of these circulars somewhere? Can we at least do as is done in 85-07-29 give a page reference to where the circular can be found. There is a fairly strong case that each circular is also a letter to M, or at least an enclosure, but I don't think we have to include it, if we point to its location.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-family: Geneva, Geneva;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-family: Geneva, Geneva;
